meanings.definition: To summarize or review the main points of something.
meanings.sent1: After the lecture, the teacher spent time recapitulating the key ideas for the students.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy recapitulating my day before going to bed to remember all the important events.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was recapitulating where it buried its nuts, but kept forgetting the exact spots.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a busy library, constantly recapitulating the books on its shelves.
meanings.sent5: The detective was recapitulating the crime scene in his mind, trying to piece together the sequence of events.

meanings.sent1: The teacher kept recapitulating the instructions to ensure everyone understood.
meanings.sent2: She was recapitulating the safety rules before the experiment started.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was recapitulating the words it had just heard, amusing everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: His words were like echoes, recapitulating through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The song's chorus kept recapitulating in her mind, refusing to fade away.

meanings.definition: To go over or go through again.
meanings.sent1: The student was recapitulating the math problems to make sure all were correct.
meanings.sent2: I will be recapitulating the steps of the experiment to see where I went wrong.
meanings.sent3: The cat was recapitulating its path through the garden, trying to find the lost toy.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood kept recapitulating in his dreams, bringing back the joy of youth.
meanings.sent5: The waves recapitulating on the shore sounded like a soothing lullaby, calming her restless mind.
